nodes.explanation:
üíé You are on version **@b6d82e42f352cadd96aee4e6b94d9992a433f280abd5512711339d54b3383631** of the **@2eb91b0cd811cbc4ef12ae2f5c5f37cbaefde75a06a822157a2dac7ee8b3694d** plan.
‚è±Ô∏è Quick onboarding will take less than a minute.
üßê Onboarding is powered by Tripetto.
nodes.name: üôè Thank you for installing Tripetto!
nodes.description:
Build awesome, smartly flowing forms and surveys like flowcharts. Embed them in your WordPress pages or use the shareable URL to publish to other channels. Collect results right inside your WordPress instance. Be fully [GDPR compliant](https://tripetto.com/blog/dont-trust-someone-else-with-your-form-data/) and have complete ownership over your forms and the collected data. That's Tripetto in a nutshell!

üê±‚Äçüíª **Your installation is almost done!**
Let's start with onboarding you by completing the Tripetto plugin installation. During this process we will help you to set up the plugin and - if you like - show you the basics of Tripetto.

Click **Next** to start.

block.caption: Your fullblown form solution inside WordPress.

nodes.explanation:
üëç **We've detected your account is authorized to manage all or some of the above topics.**
üí° To set up access rights, your account needs the **[edit\_users](https://wordpress.org/support/article/roles-and-capabilities/#edit_users)** capability. To manage the other settings, you need to have the **[manage\_options](https://wordpress.org/support/article/roles-and-capabilities/#manage_options)** capability. If you are an administrator, you will have those capabilities by default and you are always good to go.
nodes.name: üí• Let's fire things up!

nodes.explanation:
üíé You are on the **@2eb91b0cd811cbc4ef12ae2f5c5f37cbaefde75a06a822157a2dac7ee8b3694d** plan.
üßê Onboarding is powered by Tripetto.
nodes.name: üéâ You've updated Tripetto!
nodes.description: Click **Next** to find out what's new and improved.

nodes.explanation:
üíé You are on the **@2eb91b0cd811cbc4ef12ae2f5c5f37cbaefde75a06a822157a2dac7ee8b3694d** plan.
üí° This onboarding wizard is shown every time you update Tripetto.
üßê Onboarding is powered by Tripetto.
nodes.name: üéâ Welcome to the new Tripetto
nodes.description:
Thank you for installing this latest Tripetto update packed with new features and improvements. One of those new features is this onboarding wizard. It helps you to configure your Tripetto plugin.

First, click **Next** to find out what's new and improved.

nodes.explanation:
@45e9929954893b4d22e44242d450481181175588cbf3504fc8165cea11dcd1ac

üëì Read the complete **[changelog](https://gitlab.com/tripetto/wordpress/-/blob/master/CHANGELOG)** for all versions.
nodes.name: üì£ New or changed
ü•á You got yourself a free upgrade!
nodes.description:
The free version of Tripetto does no longer come with one free premium form for new free users. Also, the free version does not include all the available blocks anymore. The more advanced blocks are now only available in the **Pro** plan.

**But hold on, you are NOT a new user!**
You are an early adopter and we are very grateful for that. That‚Äôs why the form you designated as your premium form will keep all the pro features **forever**. Completely **free of charge**! You can recognize the form by the pro badge in your list of forms.

Also, you have access to all the **Pro** blocks for **free** for all of your forms as another sign of our appreciation for you using Tripetto early on. We hope you like it. Thank you again.

nodes.name: ü•á You got yourself a free upgrade!
nodes.description:
The free version does no longer include all the available blocks for new users anymore. The more advanced blocks are now only available in the **Pro** plan.

**But wait, you are NOT a new user!**
You are an early adopter and we are very grateful for that. That‚Äôs why you have access to all the **Pro** blocks for **free** as a sign of our appreciation. We hope you like it. Thank you again.

nodes.name: ‚öôÔ∏è Want to check your configuration?
nodes.description: Would you like us to guide you through your plugin settings so you can review your configuration?

nodes.name: üëã Hi, this is Tripetto!
nodes.description:
This onboarding wizard lets you change the configuration of your plugin and learn the basics of Tripetto.

üñ•Ô∏è **Currently, you are running version @b6d82e42f352cadd96aee4e6b94d9992a433f280abd5512711339d54b3383631.**
Want to know what's new and improved?

block.caption: Your fullblown form solution inside WordPress.

nodes.explanation:
@45e9929954893b4d22e44242d450481181175588cbf3504fc8165cea11dcd1ac

üëì Read the complete **[changelog](https://gitlab.com/tripetto/wordpress/-/blob/master/CHANGELOG)** for all versions.
nodes.name: üì£ New or changed
‚öôÔ∏è Want to change your configuration?
nodes.description: Would you like us to guide you through your plugin settings so you can change your configuration?

nodes.explanation:
üí° Choose *Customize* if you would like to adjust the access rights and capabilities for each built-in WordPress role. If you are not sure, just hit *Use the default settings* and you are good to go.
üëì [Learn more about configuring Tripetto access](https://tripetto.com/help/articles/how-to-configure-plugin-access-and-capabilities-with-wordpress-user-roles/)
nodes.name: üîê Access to Tripetto
nodes.description: By default your site administrators and all users that have the WordPress **Editor** role get access to Tripetto. Is this **OK** for you or do you want to customize access rights and capabilities?

nodes.explanation:
üîë **In the next step, you can specify the capabilities for each role.**
üí° If you have configured custom roles for your WordPress instance, please use your role editor to select the desired Tripetto capabilities for each role. You can use this wizard only for the built-in WordPress roles. Also, some of the above roles may be disabled if those roles are not available in your WordPress instance.
nodes.name: Who needs access to Tripetto?
nodes.description: Please select the default [WordPress roles](https://wordpress.org/support/article/roles-and-capabilities/) that need access to Tripetto.

nodes.explanation: üí° If you select *partial access* you can specify the capabilities that are granted for this role.
nodes.name: Do _@3091ff266004073986a7be721acf147dbdb14dfebfdd644931f4391c53449f92_ need full or partial access

nodes.explanation: üí° You must select at least one of the following capabilities to allow **@3091ff266004073986a7be721acf147dbdb14dfebfdd644931f4391c53449f92** access to Tripetto: Edit forms, test + publish forms, or view results. Otherwise, they won't see Tripetto in the WordPress admin menu.
nodes.name: What capabilities do _@3091ff266004073986a7be721acf147dbdb14dfebfdd644931f4391c53449f92_ need?
nodes.description: Please select all the capabilities **@3091ff266004073986a7be721acf147dbdb14dfebfdd644931f4391c53449f92** are allowed to perform.

nodes.explanation:
üí° Tripetto depends on the built-in WordPress mail functions to send emails. So please make sure your WordPress instance is able to send mail for the sender domain.
‚ö†Ô∏è If you experience problems sending emails from Tripetto, please read this [help article](https://tripetto.com/help/articles/troubleshooting-email-notifications-from-wordpress-not-sent-or-marked-as-spam/) before requesting [support](https://tripetto.com/support/).
nodes.name: üìß Email settings
nodes.description:
Tripetto can send emails using the [send email block](https://tripetto.com/help/articles/how-to-use-the-send-email-block/) inside your forms or by enabling the [email notification](https://tripetto.com/help/articles/how-to-automate-email-notifications-for-each-new-result/) for new results.

**Please specify the sender address Tripetto should use when sending email messages:**

buttons.name: Use a custom sender name and address

nodes.explanation: üí° You may leave this empty if you only want to use an email address.
nodes.name: Name of sender

nodes.explanation: üí° Ensure the mail server configured for this WordPress instance is allowed to send emails on behalf of this address.
nodes.name: Email address of sender

nodes.explanation:
üí° Choose *Customize* if you would like to adjust the protection mode or you want to configure the list of IP addresses that will be excluded.
üëì [Learn more about Tripetto's spam protection](https://tripetto.com/help/articles/how-tripetto-prevents-spam-entries-from-your-forms/)
nodes.name: üõ°Ô∏è Spam protection
nodes.description: Tripetto has a unique approach for preventing spambots abusing your forms. This solution makes [CAPTCHAs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CAPTCHA) a thing of the past. We simply don't like those strange, inaccessible puzzles, and so we've engineered a solution where we could eliminate them once and for all. It works out-of-the-box and we strongly advise to only customize the settings if you have good reason for it.

nodes.explanation: üí° If you use Tripetto to collect multiple form submissions from the same network (for example when used for a school exam with students in a room), select the *Minimal* mode or add the relevant ip addresses to the allowlist in the next step.
nodes.name: Spam protection mode
nodes.description: There is a sophisticated technique behind the submitting process that increases in difficulty each time a spammer tries to submit a form. Here you can control the mode of operation.

buttons.name: Maximal
buttons.description: Maximum protection against spambots, but slower performance.

buttons.name: **Normal**
buttons.description: Good protection against spambots while maintaining optimal performance.

buttons.name: Minimal
buttons.description: IP address checks are disabled to allow lots of submissions from the same IP address.

nodes.explanation:
üí° Both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses are allowed.
üåé Your current IP address is @b6186ff9d9046a2a4d61994c687bb7f49a2237d66d11ebe81ae6fe99fd87514c.
nodes.name: Allowlist
nodes.placeholder: Specify the IP addresses here separated with a comma
nodes.description: Fill in the IP addresses (separated with a comma) you wish to exclude from the spam protection algorithm and **always allow to submit forms**.

nodes.explanation:
‚è±Ô∏è Takes around 7 minutes to complete.
üìñ Covers the following topics:
- Building a simple form | ‚è±Ô∏è *2 minutes*
- Arranging things | ‚è±Ô∏è *1 minute*
- Navigating around | ‚è±Ô∏è *1 minute*
- Form logic | ‚è±Ô∏è *2 minutes*
- Form publishing | ‚è±Ô∏è *1 minute*

üí° You can always restart the onboarding wizard from the dashboard and follow this tutorial later if you like.
nodes.name: üéì Tutorial
nodes.description: Do you want to start a quick 5-step tutorial to learn the basics of Tripetto?

nodes.explanation:
‚úîÔ∏è Step 1 out of 5
üéì Learn more about the [basics](https://tripetto.com/help/articles/learn-the-basic-controls-to-use-the-form-builder/) of the form builder.
nodes.name: üî∞ Building a simple form
nodes.description: The Tripetto form builder is a bit different from existing tools at first sight. But, spend a minute to get the hang of it, and you'll know why we think this is a better way to create forms. Let's start with building a simple form!

nodes.explanation:
‚úîÔ∏è Step 2 out of 5
üéì Learn more about [arranging](https://tripetto.com/help/articles/learn-the-basic-controls-to-use-the-form-builder/).
nodes.name: üñ±Ô∏è Arranging
nodes.description: You can grab anything on your storyboard and move it around. Just hold the item you wish to move. After a brief moment, the item will come loose and you can drag it to a new position. This not only works with question blocks, but also with complete sections and branches.

nodes.explanation:
‚úîÔ∏è Step 3 out of 5
üéì Learn more about [navigating](https://tripetto.com/help/articles/learn-the-basic-controls-to-use-the-form-builder/).
nodes.name: üïπÔ∏è Navigating
nodes.description: There are a few controls you need to know to navigate the storyboard in Tripetto.

block.caption: Pan and zoom to get a good view!

nodes.explanation:
‚úîÔ∏è Step 4 out of 5
üéì Learn more about [logic](https://tripetto.com/help/articles/discover-the-power-of-branches-for-your-logic/).
nodes.name: üë©‚Äçüíª Logic
nodes.description: Tripetto is built up from the base to support advanced logic options to make your forms really smart. To easily let you create (and maintain) that logic, you create your forms in our visual form builder that representents your form's flow on a storyboard.

nodes.explanation:
‚úîÔ∏è Step 5 out of 5
üéì Learn more about [embedding and sharing](https://tripetto.com/wordpress/help/sharing-forms-and-surveys/) forms.
nodes.name: üöÄ Publishing
nodes.description:
When your form is ready, you can embed it on any position inside your WordPress site using the [shortcode](https://tripetto.com/help/articles/how-to-embed-your-form-in-your-wordpress-site-using-the-shortcode/), [Gutenberg block](https://tripetto.com/help/articles/how-to-embed-your-form-in-your-wordpress-site-using-the-gutenberg-block/) or [Elementor widget](https://tripetto.com/help/articles/how-to-embed-your-form-in-your-wordpress-site-using-the-elementor-widget/). You can also use the [shareable link](https://tripetto.com/help/articles/how-to-share-a-link-to-your-form-in-your-wordpress-site/) to share your form/survey on social media, via email, or any other channel you may want to use.

**How do you plan to publish your forms?**

block.caption: Embed or share your forms and collect results!

nodes.explanation:
‚úîÔ∏è Step 5 out of 5
üéì Learn more about using a [shortcode](https://tripetto.com/help/articles/how-to-embed-your-form-in-your-wordpress-site-using-the-shortcode/).
nodes.name: üöÄ Publishing
nodes.description: If you use a traditional editor in WordPress, you can embed your Tripetto forms inside your WordPress site using Tripetto's shortcode.

nodes.explanation:
‚úîÔ∏è Step 5 out of 5
üéì Learn more about using [Gutenberg](https://tripetto.com/help/articles/how-to-embed-your-form-in-your-wordpress-site-using-the-gutenberg-block/).
nodes.name: üöÄ Publishing
nodes.description: If you use the Gutenberg editor in WordPress, you can embed your Tripetto forms inside your WordPress site using Tripetto's Gutenberg block.

nodes.explanation:
‚úîÔ∏è Step 5 out of 5
üéì Learn more about using [Elementor](https://tripetto.com/help/articles/how-to-embed-your-form-in-your-wordpress-site-using-the-elementor-widget/).
nodes.name: üöÄ Publishing
nodes.description: If you use the Elementor builder in WordPress, you can embed your Tripetto forms inside your WordPress site using Tripetto's Elementor widget.

nodes.explanation:
‚úîÔ∏è Step 5 out of 5
üéì Learn more about using the [shareable link](https://tripetto.com/help/articles/how-to-share-a-link-to-your-form-in-your-wordpress-site/).
nodes.name: üöÄ Publishing
nodes.description: You can use the shareable link to share your form/survey on social media, via email, or whatever way you want to reach your potential respondents.

nodes.explanation: Or click **Next** to start using Tripetto!
nodes.name: üß† Learn even more...
nodes.description: Use the following resources to learn even more about Tripetto and its endless possibilities.

nodes.explanation:

üé§ Have some feedback? Leave it [here](https://tripetto.com/roadmap/#request-feature).
